name: Ehsaas Foundation
mission: Ehsaas helps low income families to alleviate their poverty and suffering by taking care of their basic necessities of food, water, shelter, health, education and employment – all without compromising their dignity. In addition, Ehsaas also rapidly implements emergency humanitarian relief in areas that have been struck by calamity.
theoryOfChange: Ehsaas states it helps low income families alleviate poverty and suffering by taking care of basic necessities (food, water, shelter, health, education and employment) without compromising dignity, and rapidly implements emergency humanitarian relief after calamities.
zakatClaimEvidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://www.ehsaasfoundation.org/zakat (Source: https://www.ehsaasfoundation.org/zakat)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Limited match due to weaker results and/or higher uncertainty; review methodology details before deciding.

components.evidence: Explicit zakat program (+4); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Asnaf: fuqara (+5); Operates in Muslim-majority regions (+3); Strong humanitarian service (+4)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.improvement_suggestion: Expand services to underserved populations or geographies with limited nonprofit coverage.
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 31/50: HIGH Muslim donor fit, religious cultural cause area

components.evidence: No beneficiary data available for cost-per-beneficiary scoring; high program ratio (≥85%) suggests efficient delivery
components.improvement_suggestion: Publish beneficiary counts consistently so cost-effectiveness can be assessed.
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

risks.description: No outcome measurement or metrics tracking

score_details.score_summary: Ehsaas Foundation Inc shows good impact and good alignment, with zakat compliance (minor risk deductions applied).

all_citations.claim: Ehsaas Foundation Inc focuses on poverty relief and maintains a program expense ratio of 87.8% with 6.5 months of working capital.
The charity is zakat-eligible and follows specific zakat policies for distribution.
The organization reported total revenue of $1,324,818 and a fundraising efficiency of $0.00 per $1 raised.
The foundation offers various donation options including Ramadan and Qurbani appeals.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a moderate overall score due to its high financial efficiency and religious alignment, though its total score is tempered by low data confidence and limited external verification.
areas_for_improvement: Limited third-party data availability resulting in low data confidence scores
Lack of detailed cost-per-beneficiary metrics to further validate impact depth

dimension_explanations.alignment: The organization shows high alignment for Muslim donors through its zakat-eligible status and focus on religious humanitarian appeals like Qurbani and Ramadan [2][4]. The cause urgency is high due to its focus on crisis relief and poverty [1].
dimension_explanations.impact: The foundation demonstrates a direct service model with a total revenue of $1,324,818 and a program expense ratio of 87.8% [1][3]. While the financial health is stable with 6.5 months of working capital, the impact score reflects a lack of specific cost-per-beneficiary data [1].

baseline_narrative.headline: Ehsaas Foundation Inc provides critical humanitarian relief through direct aid programs focused on poverty alleviation and crisis support.
strengths: High program expense ratio of 87.8% ensures the vast majority of funds reach those in need
Exceptional fundraising efficiency with $0.00 spent per $1 raised
Strong liquidity with 6.5 months of working capital available
baseline_narrative.summary: Ehsaas Foundation Inc is a non-profit organization dedicated to the relief of poverty and assisting the poor during times of crisis [1]. The organization operates several key programs, including Ration distribution, Qurbani, and a Ramadan Appeal, and is recognized as being zakat-eligible [2][4].

all_citations.quote: Relief of Poverty and Help the Poor in Time of Crisis

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a moderate overall score due to its high financial efficiency and religious alignment, though its total score is tempered by low data confidence and limited external verification.

areas_for_improvement.context: The charity currently reports a <cite id="3">program expense ratio of 87.8%</cite>, which is significantly below the <cite id="1">peer median of 89.8%</cite>.
The organization suffers from limited public data availability, resulting in a <cite id="1">low data confidence score</cite> and missing governance details.
The charity has experienced a contraction in funding, evidenced by a <cite id="3">3-year revenue CAGR of -17.4%</cite>.

bbb_assessment.summary: No BBB Wise Giving Alliance assessment available.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The organization maintains strong liquidity and exceptional fundraising efficiency, suggesting that low program ratios may be an artifact of specific accounting practices or temporary operational shifts rather than systemic waste.
risk_factors: <cite id="3">program expense ratio of 87.8%</cite> is well below industry standards
<cite id="3">3-year revenue CAGR of -17.4%</cite> indicates declining financial support
Low data confidence due to missing governance and impact metrics
case_against.summary: The primary concerns for donors revolve around financial efficiency and data transparency. The reported <cite id="3">program expense ratio of 87.8%</cite> is unusually low for the sector.

confidence.notes: Data confidence is low due to limited transparency and missing third-party evaluations.

alignment.explanation: The alignment score of 31/50 is driven by high Muslim donor fit, as the organization operates in <cite id="1">Muslim-majority regions</cite> and offers <cite id="2">zakat-eligible</cite> programs targeting the poor.
alignment.improvement: Expand services to underserved populations or geographies with limited nonprofit coverage to maximize cause urgency impact.

credibility.explanation: Donors should be aware that the charity has a low data confidence score due to limited transparency. While it files a <cite id="3">Form 990</cite>, it lacks comprehensive third-party evaluations and detailed governance disclosures.
credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility, the organization must improve its data transparency by publishing detailed annual reports, audited financials, and comprehensive board governance information.

impact.explanation: The impact score of 33/50 is constrained by financial metrics, notably the <cite id="3">program expense ratio of 87.8%</cite>, though it benefits from a direct service delivery model and a documented theory of change.
impact.improvement: Publish beneficiary counts consistently so cost-effectiveness can be assessed, and work to increase the proportion of total expenses directed to programs.

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade C - Limited public outcome data

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: Direct service delivery rather than grantmaking.

rich_narrative.headline: Ehsaas Foundation Inc provides critical humanitarian relief through direct aid programs focused on poverty alleviation and crisis support.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who prioritize direct humanitarian relief in specific regions like Pakistan and Bangladesh, and who are comfortable supporting organizations with limited public data transparency.
donor_motivations: Desire to fulfill zakat obligations through direct poverty alleviation
Focus on international humanitarian crises in Muslim-majority regions
Preference for organizations with zero fundraising overhead
giving_considerations: The organization has a very low reported program expense ratio
There is limited public data regarding board governance and specific cost-per-beneficiary metrics
Revenue has been declining over the past three years
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors who require rigorous academic evidence of impact, high program expense ratios, or comprehensive financial transparency.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C indicates that while the organization delivers direct services, there is a lack of rigorous, publicly available outcome data or cost-per-beneficiary metrics to verify the depth of impact.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: The organization aims to relieve poverty and assist the disadvantaged globally through direct service interventions like food distribution and health services.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Robust evidence and beneficiary tracking ensure that donor funds are translating into measurable improvements in the lives of the populations served.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: Given the declining revenue trend and low program expense ratio, the organization's capacity to efficiently absorb and deploy additional funding is unclear without further transparency.

peer_comparison.differentiator: Ehsaas Foundation operates with a <cite id="3">program expense ratio of 87.8%</cite>, contrasting sharply with the <cite id="1">peer median of 89.8%</cite>.

similar_organizations.differentiator: Similar humanitarian focus but part of a larger institutional network.
similar_organizations.name: IRUSA Waqf

strengths.detail: The organization operates with remarkable leanness in its development efforts, achieving a <cite id="1">fundraising efficiency of $0.00 per $1 raised</cite>.
The charity maintains clear religious alignment, offering programs that are <cite id="2">zakat-eligible</cite> for Muslim donors.
The organization focuses on direct humanitarian interventions, providing immediate relief through <cite id="4">Food Distribution and Health Services</cite>.

strengths_deep_dive: Ehsaas Foundation Inc demonstrates a strong commitment to direct humanitarian action. By maintaining a <cite id="1">fundraising efficiency of $0.00 per $1 raised</cite>, the organization ensures that external fundraising costs do not dilute donor contributions. Furthermore, their status as a <cite id="2">zakat-eligible</cite> institution provides a vital channel for Muslim philanthropy, specifically targeting poverty alleviation through structured initiatives like their <cite id="4">Ramadan Appeal</cite>.
rich_narrative.summary: Ehsaas Foundation Inc is a humanitarian organization dedicated to the <cite id="1">relief of poverty</cite> and assisting vulnerable populations during times of crisis. The organization operates internationally, delivering direct aid to communities in regions including <cite id="1">the Philippines, Bangladesh, and Turkey</cite>, as well as maintaining a strong geographic focus on <cite id="2">Pakistan</cite>. In 2023, the charity reported <cite id="3">$1,324,818 in total revenue</cite> to support its global operations. The organization is verified as <cite id="2">zakat-eligible</cite>, allowing Muslim donors to fulfill their religious obligations through specific initiatives like the <cite id="4">Ramadan Appeal and Food Distribution</cite> programs. Financial analysis reveals a <cite id="3">program expense ratio of 87.8%</cite>, which falls below industry standards, though the charity demonstrates exceptional <cite id="1">fundraising efficiency of $0.00 per $1 raised</cite>. The organization has faced recent financial contraction, with a <cite id="3">3-year revenue CAGR of -17.4%</cite>. Despite these financial metrics, Ehsaas Foundation continues to provide essential services such as <cite id="4">Water for Life and Health Services</cite> to underserved communities globally.
